name: Tomato
basic_care: Tomatoes need full sun and well-drained, fertile soil. Stake or cage plants to keep fruit off the ground.
watering_instructions: Water deeply 2-3 times per week, keeping the soil evenly moist but not soggy.

name: Carrot
basic_care: Carrots prefer loose, sandy soil and full sun. Thin seedlings to allow space for root development.
watering_instructions: Water consistently to keep the soil evenly moist, especially as roots are developing.

name: Spinach
basic_care: Spinach grows best in cool weather with rich, moist soil. Provide partial shade in warmer climates.
watering_instructions: Keep soil moist with frequent, light watering. Avoid letting soil dry out completely.

name: Lettuce
basic_care: Lettuce thrives in cool weather and well-drained, fertile soil. Succession planting helps extend the harvest.
watering_instructions: Water lightly and often to maintain consistent soil moisture. Avoid overhead watering to prevent disease.

name: Cucumber
basic_care: Cucumbers need full sun and rich, well-drained soil. Train vines on a trellis for better air circulation.
watering_instructions: Water regularly and deeply, especially during fruiting. Keep soil evenly moist.

name: Bell Pepper
basic_care: Bell peppers need full sun and warm temperatures. Provide support to prevent plants from toppling over.
watering_instructions: Water deeply once or twice a week, more often during dry spells. Keep soil consistently moist.

name: Zucchini
basic_care: Zucchini grows best in full sun and fertile, well-drained soil. Harvest fruits regularly to encourage more production.
watering_instructions: Water deeply once or twice a week. Avoid getting water on the leaves to reduce risk of mildew.

name: Broccoli
basic_care: Broccoli prefers cool weather and fertile, well-drained soil. Mulch to retain moisture and keep soil cool.
watering_instructions: Keep soil consistently moist with regular watering. Avoid waterlogging the roots.

name: Cauliflower
basic_care: Cauliflower needs cool temperatures and rich, moist soil. Protect from temperature extremes and pests.
watering_instructions: Water evenly and frequently to keep soil moist but not soggy.

name: Beet
basic_care: Beets grow well in cool weather and loose, well-drained soil. Thin seedlings for best root development.
watering_instructions: Water regularly to keep soil evenly moist, especially as roots form.

name: Eggplant
basic_care: Eggplants prefer full sun and fertile, well-drained soil. Stake plants to support heavy fruits.
watering_instructions: Water deeply once or twice a week, keeping the soil consistently moist.

name: Onion
basic_care: Onions need full sun and loose, fertile soil. Keep beds free of weeds.
watering_instructions: Water moderately, reducing watering as bulbs mature. Overwatering can cause rot.

name: Garlic
basic_care: Garlic prefers full sun and well-drained soil. Plant in the fall for summer harvest.
watering_instructions: Water regularly during active growth, then reduce as harvest time approaches.

name: Green Bean
basic_care: Green beans need full sun and fertile, well-drained soil. Provide support for pole varieties.
watering_instructions: Water regularly, keeping soil evenly moist but not soggy.

name: Sweet Corn
basic_care: Sweet corn requires full sun and fertile, well-drained soil. Plant in blocks for better pollination.
watering_instructions: Water deeply once or twice a week, especially during tasseling and ear development.

name: Pumpkin
basic_care: Pumpkins need full sun and rich, well-drained soil. Provide plenty of space for sprawling vines.
watering_instructions: Water deeply and regularly, especially during fruit development. Avoid wetting the leaves.

name: Turnip
basic_care: Turnips grow best in cool weather and loose soil. Thin seedlings to allow room for bulb growth.
watering_instructions: Water consistently to keep the soil moist. Do not allow soil to dry out.

name: Strawberry
basic_care: Strawberries prefer full sun and well-drained, sandy soil. Mulch helps retain moisture and suppress weeds.
watering_instructions: Water regularly to keep soil moist, especially during flowering and fruiting. Avoid wetting leaves.

name: Melon (Cantaloupe)
basic_care: Melons need full sun and warm, well-drained soil. Provide plenty of space for vines to spread.
watering_instructions: Water deeply once or twice a week. Reduce watering as fruit matures to concentrate sweetness.

name: Watermelon
basic_care: Watermelons grow best in full sun and sandy, fertile soil. Allow ample space for vines to sprawl.
watering_instructions: Water deeply and regularly, especially in early growth. Reduce watering as fruits mature.

name: Pineapple
basic_care: Pineapples thrive in warm, sunny climates and well-drained soil. Grown from the fruit's crown.
watering_instructions: Water lightly but frequently. Do not let soil dry out completely.

name: Raspberry
basic_care: Raspberries grow well in full sun and fertile, slightly acidic soil. Support canes with a trellis or stake.
watering_instructions: Water deeply once or twice a week, especially during fruit production. Keep roots moist.

name: Blueberry
basic_care: Blueberries prefer acidic soil and full sun. Mulch helps retain moisture and protect shallow roots.
watering_instructions: Water consistently, especially during fruiting. Keep soil moist but not soggy.

name: Currant
basic_care: Currants prefer cool climates, rich soil, and partial shade. Prune annually for best fruit yield.
watering_instructions: Water regularly to maintain moist soil, especially during dry periods.
